decks.notes: This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while maintaining a fast and aggressive tempo. It utilizes efficient removal spells and counterspells to control the board and protect its threats. The deck also relies on card advantage and manipulation through cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder. The inclusion of powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf ensures that the deck can close out games quickly once it gains control. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and provide access to key lands like Wasteland and Mystic Sanctuary.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to disrupt opponents while also applying pressure. It includes cards like Flickerwisp and Skyclave Apparition for removal and protection, as well as Aether Vial for mana acceleration. The deck also utilizes cards like Swords to Plowshares and Solitude for additional removal and control. The inclusion of Magus of the Moon and Wasteland are used to disrupt opponents' mana bases. The deck aims to control the board while applying pressure to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on using disruptive creatures and spells to control the opponent's board while utilizing Aether Vial and Stoneforge Mystic to quickly deploy powerful threats like Solitude and Kaldra Compleat. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for a large number of versatile cards to be included in the deck. The deck aims to pressure the opponent early with aggressive creatures and disrupt their game plan with targeted removal spells like Thoughtseize and Swords to Plowshares, ultimately overwhelming them with a consistent and efficient creature-based strategy.

This Dragon Stompy deck focuses on quick aggression and disruption through cards like Magus of the Moon, Chalice of the Void, and Blood Moon to disrupt opponent's mana base. The deck utilizes cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, Broadside Bombardiers, and Pyrogoyf for fast damage output. Chrome Mox and Ancient Tomb help ramp up mana quickly, allowing for powerful spells like Sundering Eruption and The One Ring to deal massive damage. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to secure a victory in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this Legacy Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence with efficient creatures like Brightglass Gearhulk and Springheart Nantuko. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with creatures like Ocelot Pride and Scythecat Cub, while also disrupting their game plan with cards like Static Prison and Swords to Plowshares. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration with Lotus Petal and Noble Hierarch to power out its threats. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to all colors of mana needed for the deck's spells.

The main concept of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand and board with cards like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Sheoldred's Edict while quickly applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Dauthi Voidwalker, Nethergoyf, and Barrowgoyf. The deck also utilizes efficient removal spells such as Fatal Push and Orcish Bowmasters to clear the way for its creatures. With a mix of disruption, aggression, and removal, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this Legacy deck is to control the board with countermagic and disruption spells while quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Murktide Regent to apply pressure on the opponent. By utilizing efficient spells like Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Daze alongside a mana denial strategy with Wasteland, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain tempo advantage. The inclusion of Faerie Vandal and Brazen Borrower provides additional threats and disruptive elements, allowing the deck to pivot between aggression and control based on the board state.

The deck focuses on quickly getting out an Omniscience or Show and Tell to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. It runs multiple ways to find and cast these key combo pieces, while also including cards like Force of Will and Spell Pierce for protection. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures in the early game and control the board with counter spells. It also includes cards like Cunning Wish to provide additional flexibility and options to deal with different situations.
